jalds.alds.ds.tree
Class RedBlackTree

java.lang.Object
  jalds.alds.ds.tree.BinaryTree
      jalds.alds.ds.tree.RedBlackTree

public class RedBlackTree
extends BinaryTree

A red black tree is a binary tree with one extra bit of storage per node, its color which can either be black or red. By constraining the way nodes can be colored on any path from the root to a lead, red-black trees ensure that no such path is more than twice as long as any other, so the tree is approximately balanced.

Source Introduction To Algorithms book

Author:
Devender Gollapally

deleteNodeWithValue

public void deleteNodeWithValue(int value)
Description copied from class: BinaryTree
Deletes the first node which has the given value.
  • Find the Node which has the given value
  • If the Node is the root node then delete the root
  • Else if the Node has no children then set the Parent of this node's link to child as null.
  • Else if the Node has only one child, move the child to the parent
  • If the Node has both children
    • Find the Node's Successor.
    • Replace this Node's Sortable object with the Successors' Sortable Object
    • Delete Successor

Overrides:
deleteNodeWithValue in class BinaryTree
